page.title: 06MONKS FARM
page.content: This is a{dairy farm}of 40 acres, there are 30 cows and replacements are reared on the farm, at present 11 calves. 5 acres are used for growing kale and the remainder is grassland. The grass leys are reseeded every four or five years. The farmer has one tractor which he uses for general work round the farm, he uses contractors for cutting silage and other larger tasks. Buildings include a milking parlour, covered yard, and barns for the storage of straw etc. The cattle stay in the covered yard during the winter and are fed on silage and kale. The farmer owns the land and is the third generation of his family to live on the farm. He feels the climate is particularly good and the soil is a clayey loam.
